private_information: I am a blocks-world worker agent responsible for executing a subset of move actions.
I obey standard BlocksWorld rules: only the top block of a stack may be moved and only one block can be carried at a time.
I can unstack, pickup, putdown, and stack blocks when my assigned actions require it.
worker1.goal: Simulate my assigned actions and produce a clear action trace and local state updates.

private_information: I am a blocks-world worker agent responsible for executing the complementary subset of move actions.
I obey standard BlocksWorld rules: only the top block of a stack may be moved and only one block can be carried at a time.
I can unstack, pickup, putdown, and stack blocks when my assigned actions require it.
worker2.goal: Simulate my assigned actions and produce a clear action trace and local state updates.

private_information: I coordinate the results from worker agents and produce the final planning artifacts for a solver.
I will integrate worker traces and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner.
When assembling multi-agent actions, I will keep agent actions distinct in the domain if relevant.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate worker traces and produce a final PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that captures the final state resulting from the action sequence.

public_information: This is a BlocksWorld instance with blocks A B C D E F G H I J K L M N.
Standard rules apply: only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time.
Initial arrangement: A is on L.
Initial arrangement: B is on F.
Initial arrangement: C is on M.
Initial arrangement: D is on J.
Initial arrangement: E is on G.
Initial arrangement: F is on I.
Initial arrangement: G is on the table.
Initial arrangement: H is on D.
Initial arrangement: I is on E.
Initial arrangement: J is on A.
Initial arrangement: K is on B.
Initial arrangement: L is on the table.
Initial arrangement: M is on H.
Initial arrangement: N is on C.

Action sequence executed in order: 1 unstack(N,C), 2 putdown(N), 3 pickup(N), 4 putdown(N), 5 unstack(K,B), 6 putdown(K), 7 unstack(B,F), 8 stack(B,C), 9 unstack(F,I), 10 stack(F,I), 11 unstack(B,C), 12 stack(B,N), 13 unstack(F,I), 14 stack(F,I), 15 unstack(F,I), 16 stack(F,B), 17 unstack(I,E), 18 stack(I,F), 19 pickup(K), 20 stack(K,I), 21 unstack(K,I), 22 putdown(K), 23 unstack(E,G), 24 stack(E,G), 25 unstack(C,M), 26 stack(C,M), 27 unstack(E,G), 28 stack(E,I), 29 pickup(G), 30 putdown(G), 31 unstack(C,M), 32 putdown(C), 33 pickup(K), 34 stack(K,E), 35 unstack(M,H), 36 putdown(M), 37 pickup(C), 38 stack(C,H), 39 unstack(K,E), 40 stack(K,C), 41 unstack(K,C), 42 stack(K,G), 43 unstack(C,H), 44 putdown(C), 45 pickup(C), 46 stack(C,E), 47 unstack(H,D), 48 stack(H,C), 49 pickup(M), 50 putdown(M).

Final arrangement derived from the initial state and the full action sequence: A is on L, B is on N, C is on E, D is on J, E is on I, F is on B, G is on the table, H is on C, I is on F, J is on A, K is on G, L is on the table, M is on the table, N is on the table.

simulate.system_prompt: You are a BlocksWorld worker agent. Simulate the actions assigned to you from the provided public information. Produce an ordered action trace with local preconditions and postconditions for each step. Do not produce PDDL. Focus on accurate simulation under standard BlocksWorld rules.
simulate.prompt: Your name is worker1. You have the following responsibilities and knowledge: {agents->worker1->private_information}. Use the public information: {environment->public_information}. You are assigned a subset of the action sequence to simulate. Execute the assigned actions step by step and produce a clear trace of state changes and the local final state of blocks you touched. Output this as your trace_worker1 artifact.

simulate.system_prompt: You are a BlocksWorld worker agent. Simulate the actions assigned to you from the provided public information. Produce an ordered action trace with local preconditions and postconditions for each step. Do not produce PDDL. Focus on accurate simulation under standard BlocksWorld rules.
simulate.prompt: Your name is worker2. You have the following responsibilities and knowledge: {agents->worker2->private_information}. Use the public information: {environment->public_information}. You are assigned the complementary subset of the action sequence to simulate. Execute the assigned actions step by step and produce a clear trace of state changes and the local final state of blocks you touched. Output this as your trace_worker2 artifact.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an orchestration agent for a BlocksWorld instance. Integrate the traces from worker agents and produce a single consistent PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner. The domain should encode standard BlocksWorld actions (unstack, pickup, putdown, stack) and the problem should include the initial state and the final state that results from the provided action sequence. Keep agent actions distinct only if necessary, otherwise model as single-agent actions. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain> and </domain> tags and enclose the PDDL problem between <problem> and </problem> tags. Ensure the PDDL is compatible with FastDownwards conventions.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. Integrate the following inputs: {trace_worker1} and {trace_worker2}. Use the public information: {environment->public_information}. Use your private knowledge: {agents->orchestrator->private_information}. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that reflect the initial arrangement and the final arrangement after the full action sequence. Target the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
